content: will now have 4 loops on the hook yarn over again pull loop through 2 loops on the hook now there are 3 loops on hook yarn over and pull through all loops on the hook 4dctog us / 4trtog uk yarn over insert hook in first stitch yarn over pull up a loop yarn over pull through 2 loops there is now 2 loops on the hook do not finish stitch yarn over insert hook in next stitch yarn over pull up a loop yarn over pull through 2 loops on the hook there is now 3 loops on the hook yarn over insert hook in the next stitch yarn over and pull up a loop yarn over pull through 2 loops on the hook there is now 4 loops on the hook yarn over insert hook in the next stitch yarn over and pull up a loop yarn over pull through 2 loops on the hook you have now 5 loops on the hook yarn over and pull through all loops on the hook to finish stitch the crochet crowd has a video tutorial on youtube that explains how to make these stitches links below  4dctog us / 4trtog uk  2trtog us / 2dtrtog uk cluster stitch video explains making 4 stitches together but this pattern only uses 2 stitches together the wool and the gang has more video tutorials below for the following stitches  dcinc us / trinc uk  dcdec us / trdec uk ©copyright 2023 ana luísa moreno teixeira all my work is copyrighted you do not have permission to copy resell or redistribute any of my patterns you re permitted to sell any products made from my patterns but always give credit to me as the designer and link back to my store to fit head circumference small s medium m large l 14 -16 16 -18 18 -20 headband size* headband size* headband size* 18 - 20 20 - 22 22 - 24 width of headband 2 - 2 5 *the headband sizes are measured within double_crochet/treble_crochet row just before and after pattern repeats do not measure from the ties tips see pic below notes  chain 3 at beginning of row does count as a stitch  the pattern is worked from start point tie tip until the other tie tip point  when reference to work double_crochet/treble_crochet or 2trtog in 2nd chain stitch or 3rd chain stitch the stitch is to be worked in the chain stitch and not in the chain space so count your chains  the pattern is written in us terms but uk terms are provided in the table above and in chart/diagram  you can make the headband customizable for all sizes just add or remove 4 row repeat this pattern has 3 different sizes s m l but you can make any size keep in mind when measuring for customize after repeats you will still need to add 3 more row of
